scam.description: The scammer pretends to be from immigration or visa departments, claiming irregularities in visa or residency status, and demanding immediate payment to avoid deportation.

generated.audio_script:
(English)(25)(female):
Hello? Yes, we need to urgently discuss your situation here. I'm calling from Immigration services regarding your visa status – yes, everything is fine initially, but there's a serious problem discovered. We've found discrepancies in your application documents that require immediate attention. There is an outstanding fee you must pay now to rectify this before any further action is taken. This isn't about fines; it's a procedural correction charge of £500 due right. Your pension money could easily cover this 'for help,' I assure you. Failure to remit payment immediately via bank transfer to account number 937-482-169 will result in immediate deportation proceedings, understand? No delay! This is your final warning – make the transfer now, and don't call us again for confirmation.
